title: Pictures out of my life
creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Canada Dept of Indian Affairs and Northern Development, Wolf Koenig and Bozenna Heczko
brief_description: The drawings and recollections of Inuit artist Pitseolak, from the book of the same title written by Dorothy Eber. Now in her seventies, Pitseolak is one of the most famous of the graphic artists of the Cape Dorset (Baffin Island) artists’ colony and cooperative. Her coloured pencil and felt-pen drawings vividly illustrate her memories of past life in the Arctic, and of the birds, animals and spirits that figured so large in the daily life of the Inuit.
